title: Several fan favourites are opting to skip the highly anticipated McLeod's Daughters reunion
text:
McLeod's Daughters fans are eagerly awaiting the hit Australian drama's reunion, but some may be left disappointed to learn that at least seven cast-members won't be making an appearance.

On Monday, Channel Nine confirmed the show would make a comeback for a one-night-only live event in Lismore in New South Wales.

But it has been revealed two days later that many of the show's fan-favourites won't be attending the reunion.

Giving it a miss: While many McLeod's Daughters fans are eagerly awaiting the hit Australian drama's reunion, at least seven of the show's stars will not be in attendance

Michala Banas, Sonia Todd, Rachael Carpani, Jessica Napier, Brett Tucker, Jonny Pasvolsky and Luke Jacobz will all be no-shows at the event.

It's not all bad news though, with Bridie Carter, Lisa Chappell, Simmone Jade MacKinnon, Aaron Jeffery, Myles Pollard and Zoe Naylor all confirmed to attend.

The McLeod's Daughters Bush Christmas Reunion will take place on Thursday, December 5 in Lismore City Hall.

Riding high: Channel Nine confirmed the show would make a comeback for a one-night-only live event in Lismore in New South Wales. Pictured, Brett Tucker

RSVP no: Michala Banas (pictured), Sonia Todd, Rachael Carpani, Jessica Napier, Brett Tucker, Jonny Pasvolsky and Luke Jacobz will all be no-shows at the event

The actors will be live on stage for fans to hear personal anecdotes and stories from the Drovers Run family, participate in a Q&A session, and view and discuss their favourite scenes.

There will be limited-edition McLeod's Daughters merchandise designed specifically for the event, as well as an opportunity to purchase a limited number of tickets for either the private backstage VIP tour or an intimate Golden Supper with the cast.

McLeod's Daughters, which followed the lives of five women running a cattle station in the outback, aired for eight seasons on Channel Nine between 2001 and 2009.

Not goodbye: The McLeod's Daughters Bush Christmas Reunion will take place on Thursday, December 5 in Lismore City Hall. Pictured, Jonny Pasvolsky and Rachael Carpani

It was one of the most successful shows on Australian TV, garnering an average of 1.51 million viewers during its first season.

Two years ago, reports surfaced that Channel Nine was considering a reboot.

In July 2017, a network spokesman told News.com.au: 'We are talking to [co-creator] Posie Graeme-Evans about how we could tackle it.'
description: McLeod's Daughters fans are eagerly awaiting the hit Australian drama's reunion, but some may be left disappointed to learn that at least seven cast-members won't be making an appearance.
authors: Jo Scrimshire For Daily Mail Australia
